title: CONCAT (Function)
text:
FUNCTION CONCAT : STRING(255)
Concatenates two strings
CONCAT(STR1,STR2)
means: Connect
STR1
and
STR2
to a single string
STR1STR2
.
(* Example declaration *)
VarSTRING1
:
STRING
;
(* Example in ST , result is 'SUSIWILLI' *)
VarSTRING1
:=
CONCAT
(
'SUSI'
,
'WILLI'
);

rows.Name: CONCAT
rows.Comment: Concatenated string, max. 255 characters. If the result doesnât fit into these 255 bytes, it will be silently truncated. No error is produced.

rows.Name: STR1
rows.Comment: String 1 to be concatenated, max. 255 characters

rows: String 2 to be concatenated, max. 255 characters
